content: @Gaurav Pandey (ligmitz) who can mark as resolved? Can anybody or only admins?

Actually, only admins can mark a topic as resolved. But on manually changing the topic name, the notification bot sends the event message to the topic and it looks like the topic's state has changed. Not sure if it is actually changing.
I guess this is an unintentional bug. @Tim Abbott

@Gaurav Pandey (ligmitz) anyone who has permission to edit a topic can mark it as resolved. It is possible that the special permissions for changing the topic of "(no topic)" messages should not apply to "mark as resolved".
This topic was moved here from #test here > ✔️ (no topic) by Tim Abbott

special permissions for changing the topic of "(no topic)" messages

What are those permissions?
Anyone can change the topic of a "no topic" message, as long as message editing is enabled at all.
(The intent being to make it the case that anyone can fix a new user who isn't used to using topics yet, which the ugly "no topic" styling is intended to encourage)
